title: undeclared crate or module error has invalid suggestions when implementing `fmt::Debug`

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
### Code

[play](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=1809c7d41331f36f3a326e2c47c5039c)

```Rust
pub struct S;

impl fmt::Debug for S {
    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {

    }
}
```


### Current output

```Shell
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared crate or module `fmt`
 --> src/lib.rs:2:6
  |
2 | impl fmt::Debug for S {
  |      ^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `fmt`

error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared crate or module `fmt`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:27
  |
3 |     fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {
  |                           ^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `fmt`
  |
help: consider using the associated function
  |
3 |     fn fmt(&self, f: &mut self.fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {
  |                           +++++

error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared crate or module `fmt`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:50
  |
3 |     fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {
  |                                                  ^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `fmt`
  |
help: consider using the associated function
  |
3 |     fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> self.fmt::Result {
  |                                                  +++++

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0433`.
error: could not compile `playground` (lib) due to 3 previous errors
```


### Desired output

No suggestion (suggest importing std::fmt)
